result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shamont Lakee Howell in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Shamont Lakee Howell. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states that defendant has retained Atty. Van Cuick, however, notice of retainer has not been filed.
Bail/bond hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are Employment, court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.
NG plea entered.

10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shamont Lakee Howell in court, in custodytCourt Reporter Mark Garvin. Attorney Addison Kuhn for Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Shamont Lakee Howell. 
State calls Investigator D. Rybariak-DSAT. 
Defense on cross. 
Parties rest.
State moves for bind over.
Defense on cross. 
BTC:  Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over. 
Defense files a bond motion.  Defense makes further argument.  State objects with argument.  BTC: Bond modification granted to a $3000 cash bond, same conditions, adding Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are Employment, court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
